newsitem.title: UK: Gulf ratings constrained by fiscal weakness - Moodys.
newsitem.headline: Gulf ratings constrained by fiscal weakness - Moodys.

text.p: LONDON, May 12 (Reuter) The sovereign ratings for the six Gulf Arab States rated by Moody's Investors Service are mainly constrained by the governments' weak fiscal positions rather than balance of payments difficulties, a senior sovereign analyst at Moody's said on Monday.

"In general, we would argue that unlike the case with many other sovereign ratings, it's principally the governments' weak fiscal position that constrains the ratings," David Larson, senior analyst of the sovereign risk group at Moody's told a group of reporters at a news conference.
Larson said wide structural imbalances on the fiscal side was the major cause for problems for the Gulf Arab States rather than any serious balance of payments problems.
Though the wealth of oil and gas resources in the region provides strong support for the ratings of the Gulf Arab States, Larson said it is limited because of market considerations.
"There is little risk to the governments' source of income over the next few years but not much prospect for major increases," he said.
Of the six Gulf Arab States rated by Moody's, Larson said the only country with an outlook other than stable is the United Arab Emirates, which has a positive outlook.
However, Larson said he expected upward pressure for Qatar's ratings over the next two to three years once the LNG (liquefied natural gas) projects were completed.

"Qatar's rating is pegged where it is right now at least in part because of uncertainty over the future of the LNG projects. As those are completed and come on stream, we would expect to see upward pressure over the next two to three years," he said.
Larson noted that Saudi Arabia is another country where developments were generally proceeding in a favorable direction.
Currently, Moody's rates the sovereign ratings of United Arab Emirates and Kuwait at Baa1, Qatar and Oman at Baa2, Saudi Arabia at Baa3 and Bahrain at Ba1.
